snippet: The deficit fell to $82.4 billion from $130 billion in May 2014, but much of the improvement was due to a calendar quirk.
abstract: Treasury Dept reports May budget deficit fell to $82.4 billion, from $130 billion in May 2014, but previous deficit was inflated as government mailed out $35 billion in June 2014 benefit payments during May due to calendar quirk.
lead_paragraph: The deficit fell to $82.4 billion from $130 billion in May 2014, but much of the improvement was due to a calendar quirk.

headline.main: U.S. Budget Deficit Fell in May, but Mostly on a Calendar Fluke
headline.print_headline: U.S. Budget Deficit Fell in May, But Mostly on a Calendar Fluke
